news_header: A Brazilian woman, Deise Moura dos Anjos, suspected of poisoning her husband's family with arsenic-laced Christmas cake, was found dead in her prison cell, likely a suicide.
news_original_title: Suspect in Christmas cake poisoning found dead in jail cell
news_text: She had been detained since January for allegedly murdering three relatives on Christmas Eve and attempting to murder three others. Forensic tests revealed high arsenic levels in the cake and in the body of her deceased father-in-law. Despite her denial of wrongdoing, police found evidence of her purchasing arsenic multiple times. The investigation confirmed that her mother-in-law had baked the cake, which led to the poisoning of several family members, resulting in three deaths.
